nodes.title: I.1. Residential Structures Occupying Summits: Fortresses, breastworks, religious buildings, palaces, and related edifices
General site characteristics
nodes.body: she rang mkhar gog is a small stronghold located on top of a rocky spur, overlooking the confluence of the SherangShe rang and KharlungMkhar lung valleys. These are effluents of the RusumRu gsum, a valley system rich in archaic cultural horizon archaeological sites (see A-84, A-85, A-86, A-88, A-89, B-34, B-35, B-36, B-79, B-80, B-81). This inherently defendable stronghold is suspended in the crags, 110 m above the valley floor. The site coincides with he demarcation of the upper extent of agriculture in the SherangShe rang valley and the higher pastoral lands. Like KharpocheMkhar po che (A-86), spo sa mkhar (A-84) and other summit installations in DerokSde rog township, this fortress must have been established to rule over and protect a local community.
